object.name: ReceivingAuthority
object.desc: The authority for whom the report is intended, usually the same authority that defines this manifest.

attribute.name: SIF_RefObject
attribute.desc: The name of the object referenced.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The unique identifier for this agency/report authority.

element.name: AuthorityName
element.desc: Name of the agency/report authority.

element.name: AuthorityId
element.desc: The zone unique case-sensitive identifier for the authority. This will be the contents of the SIF_SourceId element in the header of requests for reports.

element.name: AuthorityDepartment
element.desc: Department, office, or subdivision of the agency/report authority.

element.name: AuthorityLevel
element.desc: Level of the authority.

element.name: ContactInfo
element.desc: Information on the contact person in this agency.

object.name: ReportData
object.desc: Container element for the report content. This element is conditional. This element is included or the ReportInfo element is included but never both at the same time. See examples of the usage of the object below.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: This attribute indicates the source of the report definition.

attribute.name: QueryLanguage
attribute.desc: The vendor-defined query language used in the report definition (e.g. SQL, ExampleObject, com.vendor.format, etc.). If the Type attribute is SIF_Query, then QueryLanguage should also be SIF_Query. If the Type attribute is SIF_ExtendedQuery, then QueryLanguage should also be SIF_ExtendedQuery.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: This attribute indicates the encoding of the format reference.

attribute.name: ContentType
attribute.desc: The vendor-defined content type (e.g. com.vendor.format, PDF, etc.

element.name: ReportFormat
element.desc: A third-party format that describes the visual representation of the report data.

attribute.name: ReportManifestRefId
attribute.desc: The report manifest corresponding to this report.

element.name: CalculationDate
element.desc: The date on which the report was calculated.

element.name: SubmissionNumber
element.desc: A number that identifies the submission; beginning at 1 and incremented each time a submission is done for a particular report; used to indicate resubmission(s).

element.name: SubmissionReason
element.desc: Reason for the report submission.

element.name: BeginReportDate
element.desc: The first date for which the report contains information.

element.name: EndReportDate
element.desc: The last date for which the report contains information. May be the same as BeginReportDate for snapshot-type reports.

element.name: BeginSubmitDate
element.desc: The first date on which the report may be submitted to the authority.

element.name: EndSubmitDate
element.desc: The last date on which the report may be submitted to the authority.

element.name: DueDate
element.desc: The official due date of the report.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The unique identifier for this report manifest.

attribute.name: ReportAuthorityInfoRefId
attribute.desc: ID (GUID) of the authority providing this manifest.

element.name: SIF_Version
element.desc: Specifies which SIF Specification version should be used when returning the report data; wildcards are allowed. When a wildcard is specified, the responding agent SHOULD attempt to return the report data in the version specified by SIF_Message/@Version, if that version matches the wildcard version. If not, the responding agent can return the data in any version it chooses that matches the wildcard version.

element.name: SIF_MaxBufferSize
element.desc: Specifies the maximum size of a packet to be returned to the report authority.

element.name: ReportName
element.desc: The authority's accepted name for the report.

element.name: Description
element.desc: The description for the report.

element.name: ReportDefinitionSource
element.desc: Indicates where the report definition can be found. If Type is Embedded or Base64Binary, this element's value contains the report definition. If Type is URL, this element's value is the location of the external definition. A Type value of SIF_Query indicates that the SIF_QueryGroup element contains the definition.

element.name: SIF_ExtendedQuery
element.desc: Query criteria for extracting the report information if ReportDefinitionSource/@Type is SIF_ExtendedQuery.

element.name: TextData
element.desc: Contains arbitrary text, encoded in UTF-8.

element.name: BinaryData
element.desc: Contains the base64Binary encoding of binary or text data not encoded in UTF-8.

object.name: ReportSubmitterInfo
object.desc: Identifies the submitter of the report.This element is conditional depending on the context in which the SIF_ReportObject is used. It must be present in the ReportInfo element when a SIF_ReportObject is sent to a report authority in a SIF_Event message. However, its presence is optional in SIF_ReportObject packets delivered to report authorities in SIF_Response messages.

element.name: SIF_RefId
element.desc: If the submitter is described by another SIF data object such as a SchoolInfo or LEAInfo instance, this element references that object by RefId.

element.name: SubmitterName
element.desc: Name of the report submitter.This is a descriptive string that names the entity submitting the SIF_ReportObject to the report authority. It could be the name of an agency, a district, a school, the SIF_SourceId of the submitting agent, or any other string that a report authority could use to identify the submitter of a report. This element may be present regardless of the presence of the SifRefIdType and SifRefId elements. When those elements are used, it is recommended that collector agents reproduce the name of the LEA or school here.

element.name: SubmitterDepartment
element.desc: Department, office, or subdivision of the agency submitting the report.

element.name: ContactInfo
element.desc: Information on the contact person in this agency submitting the report. For a description of this element, see 5.1.3 ContactInfo.

element.name: Address
element.desc: For a description of this element, see 5.1.1 AddressAddress.

element.name: PhoneNumber
element.desc: For a description of this element, see 5.1.22 PhoneNumber.

element.name: SubmitterNotes
element.desc: Optional notes for the report authority, such as information about a district's reporting policies and procedures, instructions for contacting the district for technical support, etc.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: The functional level of the requesting agency.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The ID (GUID) that uniquely identifies this instance of a report.

element.name: ReportData
element.desc: Container element for the report content; one valid SIF object can occur as a child here. This element is conditional. This element or ReportInfo or SIF_ExtendedQueryResults is included but never at the same time. See examples of the usage of the object below.

element.name: SIF_ExtendedQueryResults
element.desc: The report content resulting from a SIF_ExtendedQuery-based report. This element is conditional. This element or ReportInfo or ReportData is included but never at the same time.

element.name: Relationship
element.desc: Relationship to the student.

element.name: Name
element.desc: The name(s) of the contact.

element.name: OtherId
element.desc: The ID(s) of the contact.

element.name: EducationalLevel
element.desc: Highest level of education completed by the contact.

object.name: StudentLocator
object.desc: An example SIF object that serves as a template for matching objects. There is an implied EQ operator for every element/attribute value present and an implied And group of all resulting conditions. Currently this is an experimental feature and limited to use with StudentLocator; wider use may be considered in future major versions of this specification.

attribute.name: IdStatus
attribute.desc: Communicates the orchestration status for the object.

attribute.name: TransactionId
attribute.desc: GUID that allows requesters and responders to refer to the same logical StudentLocator "transaction" over more than one SIF_Request/SIF_Response exchange.

element.name: StateProvinceId
element.desc: This is the student's state-assigned ID. May be empty in a response where IdStatus is "Ambiguous."

element.name: Confidence
element.desc: Confidence score. The main use of this element is when IdStatus equals "Ambiguous" and the state returns one or more* candidate matches. The interpretation is that the information populated in each returned object matches the information in the request to the extent expressed in this score. The matching/scoring algorithms (and resultant values) are defined by the particular state.

element.name: LocalId
element.desc: This is the requesting agency's unique ID for the student.

element.name: StudentPersonalRefId
element.desc: Requesting agency's local zone GUID of the student's StudentPersonal object.

element.name: RequestingAgencyId
element.desc: Identification of the agency and/or location requesting the state ID. Optional because the SIF Zone infrastructure may provide adequate information for the state to ascertain the origin of the request.

element.name: GradeLevel
element.desc: The student's current grade level.

element.name: SSN
element.desc: Social security number of the student.

element.name: Name
element.desc: The name(s) of the student.

element.name: Address
element.desc: The address(es) of the student.

element.name: Demographics
element.desc: Demographic information about the student. This will typically be the core matching information. Privacy considerations may mean that it is filled differently here than it might be in a local StudentPersonal, but it must include enough to drive the state's matching algorithms.

element.name: EffectiveDate
element.desc: For Requests, this should match StudentSchoolEnrollment/EntryDate.

element.name: GraduationDate
element.desc: Indicates the date the student graduated--GradYear, GradYear and GradMonth, or GradYear, GradMonth and GradDay may be specified. Intended to facilitate locating students that may not be currently enrolled in a school or district, particularly in the context of locating student identifiers for initiating a request for a student's academic record. Supplied date values may often be approximations made by the entity endeavoring to request a student's academic record.

element.name: SchoolAttendedName
element.desc: The name of the school last attended by the student.

element.name: SchoolAttendedLocation
element.desc: The location of the school last attended by the student (e.g. city or county name, district name, etc.).

element.name: OtherId
element.desc: Additional student identifier not represented elsewhere in StudentLocator (e.g. the driver's license number of the student).

element.name: SIF_Error
element.desc: When IdStatus is set to Error, this element provides details about the error. Rather than the specification defining a list of possible error categories and codes for StudentLocator transactions, the SIF_Category and SIF_Code elements may contain values defined by the application that is responding to the StudentLocator request. It is recommended the requester convey these values in log files or error reports, along with the SIF_Desc and optional SIF_ExtendedDesc elements.
